critique: This document reflects a historical perspective on Native American affairs, specifically the establishment of a reservation for the Snake or Piute Indians in 1872. Given the time period, the approach is paternalistic and focused on government control over Native American lands and lives. There is no emphasis on Native American sovereignty or self-determination, which would be considered a liberal viewpoint today. The document reflects the prevailing attitudes of the time, which prioritized westward expansion and assimilation of Native Americans into American society.
